intro: Rubus albemarlensis, commonly known as the Albermarle blackberry, is a species of brambles native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
